body:
I meet the same warn. It is because of dependency confilicts, you can use `maven-enforcer-plugin` to find confilicts.

```
<plugins>
        <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-enforcer-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>1.4.1</version>
                <configuration>
                    <rules><dependencyConvergence/></rules>
                </configuration>
        </plugin>
</plugins>
```
then run 

`mvn enforcer:enforce`
Fixed

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/20376240/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/20376240)

Coverage decreased (-0.002%) to 12.031% when pulling **1afa882e3288415ad7c81bf21caca4d8cf7d1875 on JaredTan95:elasticsearch-namespace-config** into **76d2fa34e0b15d6c888649a14d3807307ff1bf6b on apache:master**.

From your changes seems ok, but I don't sure it was fixed this issue really. 
Do you confirm the number of the file open handles by the collector's process? Recommended you refer to the following step for check.  
1. Check the number of the file open handles after collector startup.
1. Change the buffer config in application.yml. 
`
bufferOffsetMaxFileSize: 1 # Unit is MB
bufferDataMaxFileSize: 1 # Unit is MB
bufferFileCleanWhenRestart: true
`
1. Send more than 1k trace segments with different operator name to trigger the trace buffer reader and writer operate. And set a too long string into span's log, it could make the trace segment's length too long to let the buffer manager open more files.
1. Check the number of the file open handles after segments send finish.
1. Make sure the number of the file open handles is same as the number after collector startup.
yes. it was tested online over 40000 cpm. the number of the offset file handles is 0.

the problem is the randomAccessFile is always null in FileUtils.writeAppendToLast(File file, RandomAccessFile randomAccessFile, String value), so the process create new RandomAccessFile again and again without closing
@IanCao OK, thanks very much. Travis CI build not complete. A check error, please check it. I will merge your pr after CI successful.
And you need to put a document for backend namespace, which only in 5.x for now.

I doubt the namespace works for cluster management module. Zookeeper cluster management has this setting?
If only elastic search supports namespace, it only provide index name prefix. That is all.
Look like TiDB has a good compatible with MySql driver and syntax. Could you put which version of MySQL driver, and keep a notice to user, they need to download and copy driver lib.

> I doubt the namespace works for cluster management module. Zookeeper cluster management has this setting?

As far as i kown, Zk has not this settings in skywalking collector.right?

## MySQL
Active MySQL as storage, set storage provider to **mysql**. 

**NOTICE:** MySQL driver is NOT allowed in Apache official distribution and source codes. 
Please download MySQL driver by yourself. Copy the connection driver jar to `oap-libs`.

```yaml
storage:
  mysql:
```

All connection related settings including link url, username and password
are in `databsource-settings.properties`. 
This setting file follow [HikariCP](https://github.com/brettwooldridge/HikariCP) connection pool document.

## TiDB
Currently tested TiDB in version 2.0.9, and Mysql Client driver in version 8.0.13.
Active TiDB as storage, set storage provider to **mysql**. 

```yaml
storage:
  mysql:
```

All connection related settings including link url, username and password
are in `databsource-settings.properties`. And these settings can refer to the configuration of *MySQL* above.

@WithLin we got 8 passes, and 4 fails. Could you recheck? Look like the 4 of 5 latest versions fail.

@wu-sheng 
I have completed the following test to confirm that the function is in line with expectations.
1. Start backend, grpc server (agent).
2. Send a grpc call, es has a segment to come in.
3. Stop backend and es.
4. Delete the es data directory.
5. Start es and backend, and find that there is no registration data in es. After starting backend, there will be jvm metrics coming in.
6. Change the status of the grpc server's reset.status to ON, and soon there will be registration data coming in.
7. Initiate a grpc call again and find that segment data goes into es.

this time, I deploy oap with a different configuration. first I use h2 as the storage. after 8 hours , It is normal.
second, I use es as the storage, after 8 hours , It is normal. third,I use es as the storage, and config the namespace in system environment with SW_STORAGE_ES_NAMESPACE,after 8 hours ,It no longer collects a bit of data. So I can only restart the oap component to make it back to normal.
@wu-sheng @peng-yongsheng  Can you give some ideas to consider what is the trigger?

If the namespace, there is a bug fixed in beta milestone, the delete mechanism doesn't work right. So, based on the things you provided, it may be caused by ElasticSearch overload. That is the only thing I could relate with.
@a198720 Do you want to continue this contribution? @JaredTan95 How about starting to new PR to fix this?

> I prefer you could contribute this as optional plugin. Do you have interests to do that?

I will create a pull requests later, if @candyleer haven't develop this feature yet.As for the location of this feature's code, in order to keep consistent with logback's mdc, I think it may be better to still in `apm-toolkit-log4j-2.x-activation` plugin:

![image.png](https://upload-images.jianshu.io/upload_images/191937-e6bb6f41cc9ec593.png?imageMogr2/auto-orient/strip%7CimageView2/2/w/1240))
I adjusted the test case again, and then ran all versions of rabbitmq in my local environment, all compatible. Please run the test case again. @wu-sheng

Do you depend on anything in tookit activation? Toolkit activation is an auto actived plugin, so that means, this log plugin always works, which could affect user's existing log analysis system. That is why I suggest to put it in the optional plugin.

I am not very familiar with MDC, so maybe I am wrong. The principle is don't affect user's existing log.
